content.webTitle: University guide 2016: the College of Estate Management

fields.headline: University guide 2016: the College of Estate Management
fields.bodyText: Founded in 1919, the College of Estate Management (CEM) provides supported online learning courses for real estate and construction professionals. Its construction and real estate related courses are at undergraduate and postgraduate level. Most courses are accredited or recognised by the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors, the Chartered Institute of Building and British Council of Shopping Centres. In 2012 CEM was granted taught degree awarding powers, which came into effect on 1 January 2013. Its new CEM-validated degrees started in autumn 2013 and a postgraduate offer began in September 2014. All CEM degree programmes are taught through supported online learning, so students can study in their own time. All learning materials are accessible through CEM's virtual learning environment, a specialised online resource. Fees BScs cost £15,640, a Foundation degree costs £7,200. Bursaries CEM has a discretionary bursary scheme to help new undergraduate students on low incomes or in financial need. The scheme, in the form of discounted fees for the duration of the course, will help students participate in selected CEM courses. Contact Tel: 0800 019 9697 (UK) or +44 (0) 118 921 4696 (International) E-mail: enquiries@cem.ac.uk Web: cem.ac.uk
